definition:
Let $V$ be a normed vector space with norm $\| \cdot \|$. Let $M$ be a
closed subspace of $V$ and $V/M$ the quotient vector space.

The norm $\| \cdot \|$ induces a norm $\| \cdot \|_{V/M}$ in $V/M$,
called the [**quotient norm**]{}, given by

$$\| v+M \|_{V/M}:= \inf_{u \in v+M} \|u\| = \inf_{m \in M} \|v+m\|$$

[**Theorem -**]{} $\| \cdot \|_{V/M}$ is a norm in $V/M$ iff $M$ is
closed in $V$.
